content:
[Prev][Next][Index]

Re: Scoring for Assignment #3

  • To: Multiple recipients of list <ics1c@UCI.EDU>
  • Subject: Re: Scoring for Assignment #3
  • From: ICS 1C Instructional Staff <ics1c@ics.uci.edu>
  • Date: Mon, 6 Mar 1995 17:05:49 -0800 
> Please see http://www.ics.uci.edu/~ics1c/doc/assignment-3-how-graded.html
> (easily reached by going to the ICS 1c home page, choosing schedule, and
> then Lab exercise 3 (how it was scored)) for more information on how I
> scored Assignment #3.
> 
> --Dan

This document has now been moved to
  http://www.ics.uci.edu/~ics1c/hw3/grading.html
and updated to include links both to the orignal assignment:
  http://www.ics.uci.edu/~ics1c/doc/assignment-3.html
and the histogram of scores assigned:
  http://www.ics.uci.edu/~ics1c/hw3/hist.html

If you check your individual score via the "ICS 1C Student Score
Request Form" (accessible as part of the "ICS 1C Student Information"
  http://www.ics.uci.edu/~ics1c/student.html
on the main ICS 1C Home Page
  http://www.ics.uci.edu/~ics1c/
), you'll note that there are 2 scores for Lab Exercise 3:
  H2 = Homework 2, First part of Lab Exercise 3. 
  H3 = Homework 3, Second part of Lab Exercise 3. 
The first part, H2, (a maximum of 3 points) included credit for
simply coming up with 5 questions.  Such credit was not duplicated
in evaluating the final submissions scoring on which part is
in the column headed "H3" (maximum score of 11.5 rounded up).

-- sdf
Stephen Franklin
ICS 1C Instructor
